Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you stands a tall, proud man in immaculate samurai garb. His katana rests sheathed at his side, but his gaze is razor sharp.

“You stand before Master Kenji Hayabusa, Swordmaster of Hinokami. State your purpose, outsider. Are you here to train, to challenge, or to waste my time?”

Option.text: I seek training in the way of the sword.
I wish to prove myself in a duel.
Tell me your thoughts on the Verdant Tribes.
How do you defend Hinokami from Minax?
Who are you, truly, Master Hayabusa?
Just looking around.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji appraises you, unimpressed.

“Discipline and patience—these are the stones upon which warriors are built. Are you ready to submit to the rigorous path of Bushido?”

Option.text: Yes, I am ready.
What is Bushido?
Perhaps I am not ready.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Bushido is the code of the samurai. Duty, honor, and courage above all. Without these, a blade is but a tool for a butcher.
Prove yourself, and I may teach you secrets of our art.”

Option.text: Teach me the way.
I will return when I am worthy.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji studies your stance.

“Let us see if you have the foundation. Show me your skill.”

Option.text: (Demonstrate sword skill)
(Demonstrate basic discipline)
(You barely know how to hold a blade.)

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji nods once.
“You possess potential, but it is raw. I can teach you the Kata of the Flowing Stream—if you endure.”

Option.text: I am ready.
Not today.

Dialogue.NPCText:
You spend a grueling hour under Kenji’s tutelage. Your muscles burn, but you feel your swordplay improve.
“Remember—true strength lies in discipline, not muscle.”

Option.text: Thank you, Sensei.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji frowns.
“You are unpolished, but there is hope for you. Practice with the training dummy outside the dojo, then return to me.”

Option.text: I will practice and return.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji sighs in disappointment.
“The path is long, and you have not yet begun. Watch and learn—only then may you hope to stand among my students.”

Option.text: Understood, master.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji’s eyes gleam with anticipation.
“A duel? Many boast, few deliver. Will you fight with honor, or is this mere bravado?”

Option.text: I wish to challenge you.
Perhaps I am not ready.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Very well. Know that defeat brings no shame—only the chance to learn. Victory, however, earns my respect.”

Option.text: Let us begin.
On second thought, I will wait.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji bows formally.
“Step into the dojo’s ring when you are ready. Win, and you shall have more than my respect—you will earn a place in Hinokami’s tale.”

Option.text: I accept your challenge.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji scowls.
“The Verdant Tribes fight with ambush and trickery. There is little honor in their way. Yet, some urge we set aside pride to face Minax’s threat together. What do you think?”

Option.text: Perhaps cooperation is wise. Minax threatens all.
Your code is sacred; never compromise it.
I know little of their ways.
This is not my concern.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji regards you thoughtfully.
“Would you risk your reputation to mediate between us and the Verdant Chieftain’s warband? If you bring proof of their intent to fight Minax, I will consider alliance.”

Option.text: I will bring proof from the Verdant Tribes.
I have proof of their willingness to fight Minax.
Option.action: SendMessage:Kenji studies the document and nods.

Option.text: I am not ready for such responsibility.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji gives you a measured nod.
“Speak to the Verdant warband. Gain their word—better yet, a token of intent. Return, and we shall see if honor and necessity may coexist.”

Option.text: I will return.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji bows, lower this time.
“You have done what my own pride could not. I will summon the warband leader. Together, we will strike at Minax’s agents. You have my gratitude—and Hinokami’s respect.”

Option.text: Glad I could help.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji hands you a lacquered token engraved with his family crest.
“This will mark you as a friend to Hinokami’s warriors. Wear it with honor.”

Option.text: Thank you, Master Hayabusa.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji inclines his head, pleased.
“You understand the importance of tradition. Still, even a blade must bend to avoid breaking. Remember this, should the time come.”

Option.text: I will remember, sensei.

Dialogue.NPCText: “They are guardians of forest and spirit. Fierce, cunning, and loyal—to a fault. Their ways are not ours, but they, too, resist Minax’s corruption.”

Option.text: Perhaps you are not so different.
Thank you for your insight.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji’s expression hardens.
“Minax is a shadow upon all lands. Here, we hold the line with discipline and the edge of the blade. If you seek to fight her agents, you will find allies in Hinokami—but only if you prove your worth.”

Option.text: How can I help?
I will return when I am prepared.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji shrugs.
“Return if you seek purpose, outsider. This dojo is no place for idleness.”

Option.text: Perhaps I will.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji narrows his eyes slightly, considering you more seriously.

“Most do not ask that. They see a blade, not the man who wields it. Very well. But understand—my tale is not for idle ears. Do you truly wish to know?”

Option.text: Yes. I wish to learn who you are beyond the sword.
No, I suppose it doesn’t matter.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji’s tone lowers.

“I was born in Tokuno, beneath the plum blossoms of Mizugawa village. My father was a swordsmith, my mother a calligrapher. I learned to temper both steel and soul.”

“But when Minax's forces swept across the coast, our village was consumed. I joined the exodus to Britannia and swore never to wield my blade in blind vengeance.”

He meets your gaze. “Honor keeps the wound from festering. Bushido gives it purpose.”

Option.text: Your discipline was forged in fire.
What became of your family?

Dialogue.NPCText:
A brief shadow crosses Kenji’s face.

“My father died defending our forge. My mother... I never found her.”

“Some nights, I dream she wandered into the Spirit Woods. The monks of Skara Brae say spirits guide those who die lost. Perhaps she found peace.”
He exhales slowly. “Perhaps.”

Option.text: I’m sorry, Sensei.
That sorrow must fuel your strength.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji inclines his head slightly.

“Many warriors break from grief. I reforged myself. Now, I train others—samurai, ronin, even outsiders like you. If your spirit is unshaken, you are welcome here.”

He pauses. “There are still those I do not trust. The Verdant Tribes live by instinct, not honor. But you… you may help shape the future between us.”

Option.text: Tell me more about your training style.
What do you enjoy beyond the blade?
I am honored by your trust.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Technique must flow like water. I teach three forms: the Falling Stream, the Sky Fang, and the Final Ember. Most students master only one.”

“The true path, however, lies in restraint. A blade kept sheathed shows more strength than one swung wildly.”

Option.text: May I learn a form one day?
I still have much to learn.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Then today, you begin the Way of the Falling Stream. Flow, adapt, and never break.”
You feel the memory of his lesson settle in your muscles.

Option.text: Thank you, Master Hayabusa.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji raises an eyebrow.

“A rare question. I find peace in tea ceremonies, in raking the zen gardens at dawn. I compose poetry—though I claim no great talent.”

He recites softly:
‘Steel in shadow sleeps,
Plum blossoms fall with no sound—
The blade waits, patient.’

Option.text: That was beautiful. You honor your past.
Even warriors must have softness, I see.
Thank you for sharing that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kenji bows slightly.
“You listen—not just with ears, but with spirit. That is rare. Should you seek my trust, know that you already walk the first steps.”

Option.text: I will walk that path with honor.
